content.description: Start just to the right of the tree standing. There are not many good footholds to do the dyno making this a very challenging climb. he second dyno however, is much easier and more doable. You might not even have to jump if your arms are long enough.
content.location: For this route go to the side of the boulder where a tree is growing almost into it. Start just to the right of the tree standing or squatting if you are tall.

content.description: For this route you should start at the bottom of the crack and climb to the top. Make sure not to use the rock behind you. This route is very hard to top off and pull yourself over the edge.
content.location: This Crack is the same crack as crack 1, but is on the other side. there is or there might not now, a old chair right by the bottom of the crack.

content.description: This climb is one of the harder boulder cracks I have done. The sun does not shine at all on this climb because of all the shade, but the boulder is beautiful and is one of the bigger one I have seen.
content.location: This bouldering route is located on the side of the boulder that is white. The climb start at the only crack on that side of the wall and ends once you top out on the top of the crack.

content.description: This route is a sit start below the route Double Double Dyno. start in the the little caveish like area below Double Double Dyno and start your climb. make sure to connect to Double Double Dyno or else you are not doing the route.
content.location: Sit start in the caveish like area below Double Double Dyno

content.description: This single boulder is the only boulder known around the loon lake area that I could find. The boulder is about 14 feet tall and has 4 different routes to get up. The top of the boulder is growing so make sure not to bother any of the life. The boulder can be climbed by two cracks and 2 other routes. This boulder stands out in a boulder cluster as the biggest one. Most of the other boulders in the cluster are about 3 feet max.
